page.title: 08Restoration of old mill
page.content: Sponsored by Oxfordshire County Council (Department of Museum Services) there is a restoration project by the Wantage Industrial Archaeology Group for the mill on the River Ock. The Mill is to be restored to working condition and open to the public as a site museum. Work began in l977. The machinery was treated for rust and woodworm, the stonework has been brushed and repainted, and some window sills and floorboarding have been renewed. A new access stairway is now under construction. A replacement wheel has been obtained, and is undergoing restoration. It will be then be fitted to the original shaft. Volunteers work on the project every alternate Sunday morning. Much remains to be done, but when all is completed, there will be a working mill on this site which was recordede in the 1st Domesday survey.
